Class to describe energy behavior of modeled facilities. This class includes different energy key performance indicators.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: this property was known as "currentlyConsumesEnergy" in prior versions of the ontology
how much energy is consumed by an energy facility at a certain point in time

rdf:Description.dc:title: OEMA Energy and equipment ontology
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
This ontology represents the following energy equipment: building automation system resources (sensors, actuators/controllers and Heating, ventilating and air conditioning (HVAC) systems), industrial equipment (i.e. construction and manufacturing equipment), energy generators (i.e. Electric Vehicles (EVs), Home Power Plants, etc.), Loads (white and brown goods), power storage/energy carriers (gas energy carriers, electrical batteries, etc.) and wearable devices.
The ontology also represents the following data: devices Demand Response events, flex-offers, devices power curve and power profile, device operation category (i.e. on-off device, finite state machine,etc.), energy sources (renewable and non-renewable), devices consumption category and device state.
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Javier Cuenca Ariza

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: GroupFunctionality
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Derives from the general cluster functionalities defined in ZigBee HA specifications

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TemperatureSensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sensor that detects the temperature of the atmosphere

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TemperatureMeasurementNotificationFunctionality
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Notifies the measurment of a temperature, through a proper temperature sensor

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxProducesEnergy
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy value of the specified energy resource in full operation
This class is used to model sound system devices. They are set of equipment for the reproduction and amplification of sound.
Sensor that controls if a door is closed

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class models the electrical appliaces with power rating ranging from 0-10Watts
This class is used to model a toothbrush with an electric motor in the handle that vibrates the head of the brush.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: GasSensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Device that senses the presence of gas in the air
This class is used to model a machine or device for drying something, especially laundry.
Dryer

hasBuildingAutomationNetworkType
Connects a domotic facility with the representation of its supported building automation network

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: unit to which this value is related to. value of this related unit is always 1 if no related value is given, while the native value for the given energy unit is set in relation to this (e.g. KwH/Liter)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy costs in terms of monetary amount per kilowatt

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The field of application of a certain facility or zone

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Pump device is a pump that may have variable speed. It may have optional built-in sensors and a regulation mechanism. It is typically used for pumping water. Derives from ZigBee HA specifications.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: LightSensor

This class is used to model convection heaters. In a convection heater, the heating element heats the air in contact with it by thermal conduction. Hot air is less dense than cool air, so it rises due to buoyancy, allowing more cool air to flow in to take its place. This sets up a convection current of hot air that rises from the heater, heats up the surrounding space, cools and then repeats the cycle. They are ideally suited for heating a closed space. They operate silently and have a lower risk of ignition hazard if they make unintended contact with furnishings compared to radiant electric heaters. This is a good choice for long periods of time, or if left unattended.

This class is usde to model storage heaters. The storage heater stores heat in clay bricks, then releases it during the day when required. Water can also be used as a heat-storage medium.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Device for manual interaction with the system as well as visualization of system states.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Components manufactured by ZigBee

This class is used to model devices for charging or recharging an accumulator or rechargeable battery. It emcompasses instruments that charges or replenishes storage batteries. This class is further divided into various different types of charging devices.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AnsweringMachine
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electronic device that answers the telephone and records messages
This class is used to model a device, which is used to put energy into a secondary cell or rechargeable battery of a camera by forcing an electric current through it.

This class is used to model a device, which is used to put energy into a secondary cell or rechargeable battery of a mediaplayer (sound system, DVD player etc) by forcing an electric current through it.

This class is used to model storage tank heaters. These are the most commonly used water heaters. They hold 76 to 380 litres (20 to 100 gallons) of hot water – enough for most homes. Today's energy-efficient models feature extra insulation, which reduces heat loss through the tank walls.
StorageTankHeater
ComboWaterHeater

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This propert is used to relate energy equipment with energy performance indicators (i.e. energy cost related to energy performance).

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: describes the percentage of an energy source in the energy mix of an energy provider

This class is used to model a machine that dispenses small articles such as food, drinks, when a coin or token is inserted. They are usually fitted with refigeration.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The multicast address of the gateway

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: hasName

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Field Of Application for facilities connected with liquid supply as well as removal

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: physicalAddress
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The address of the component
The representation of a working mode of a device, e.g. for a washing machine it can be a cycle for 'synthetics'.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: hasCurrentStateValue
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: this property was known as "hasActiveMode" in prior versions of the ontology
The currently active mode (StateValue) of a facility

This class is used to model refrigeration devices that consist of a thermally insulated compartment and a heat pump (mechanical, electronic, or chemical) that transfers heat from the inside of the fridge to its external environment so that the inside of the fridge is cooled to a temperature below the ambient temperature of the room. This class is further divided into different kinds of referigerators.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BoilerController
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Device for controlling a boiler facility

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: HumiditySensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Device that senses the air relative humidity

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: DoubleValuedNotification
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Discrete notification with exactly two values
Relates a given domotic component with the network level gateway used to control it

This class is used to model underflow heater. These systems are called radiant heating systems, and are electrically powered. When a home radiant heat system is turned on, current flows through a conductive heating material. For high-voltage radiant heat systems, line voltage (110 V or 230 V) current flows through the heating cable. For low-voltage systems, the line voltage is converted to extra low voltage (8 to 30 V) in the control unit (which contains a step-down transformer), and this low voltage is then applied to the heating element.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Lamp
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An artificial source of visible illumination

This class is used to model Immersion heaters, where Water is most often heated electrically by putting a heating element in direct contact with it. Such an element is therefore called an immersion heater. The water to be heated is usually enclosed inside an insulated cylinder: a hot water tank. Such a heating element consists of a thin metal tube that contains an electrical resistance heater; this, in turn, is encased in an insulating material.
this object property models the connection between an energy type and its default energy provider
System that is capable of changing air state (e.g. cooling, heating, etc.)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: GasoilHeater
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Heater that combusts gasoil

This class is used to model a heat pump that uses an electrically-driven compressor to operate a refrigeration cycle that extracts heat energy from the outdoor air or from the ground or ground water, and upgrades its temperature to a level high enough to use for space heating. The working fluid boils at a low temperature, absorbing heat in an outdoor heat exchanger, then the resulting vapor is compressed and condenses to liquid form in a condensor inside the building. Heat from the condensor is absorbed by the air in the building (and sometimes also used for domestic hot water).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: hasEnergyProductionForecast
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy generation forecast of Distributed Energy Sources (i.e. Photovoltaics).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VentilatingFOA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Field Of Application for a facility connected to ventilation without fresh external air

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WorkingFOA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Field Of Application for a room or facility that is used for working purposes

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: LiquidDrainageFOA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Field Of Application for facilities connected with liquid removal

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BuildingAutomationNetwork
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specific networks for building automation devices.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ElectricEnergyProvider
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy providers that provide electricity for the end-users.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SelfClosingDoorActuator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A mechanism that allows the automatic closing of the door after a certain time

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ShadeActuator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Shade Actuator device provides the ability to open or close window coverings, including setting partially open or partially closed states. This device type includes roller shades, drapes and tilt-only blinds actuators. Derives from ZigBee HA specifications (Shade device)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A device that circulates fresh air and expels stale or foul air.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Pressure Sensor device measures and periodically reports the pressure of a liquid (typically water)

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The value of the state of an object

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy form found in nature that has not been subjected to a transformation process.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: LightSensingFunctionality
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The capability of sensing the luminance of the environment in which a device is located accepts only the get command, with 1 parameter, i.e. the luminance value. Derives from ZigBee specifications

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy tariff refunded by providers for recovered energy through e.g. solar collectors

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: LED

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Shutter
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A hinged cover or screen for a window, usually fitted with louvers.

This class is used to model radiative heaters. Radiative heaters contain a heating element that reaches a high temperature. The element is usually packaged inside a glass envelope resembling a light bulb and with a reflector to direct the energy output away from the body of the heater. The element emits infrared radiation that travels through air or space until it hits an absorbing surface, where it is partially converted to heat and partially reflected.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergyConsumerFacility
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Building Facility that consumes some amount of energy

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CO2Sensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sensor that detects CO2 concentration in the air

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TemperatureState
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Models the temperature value

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: StorageFOA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Field Of Application for a room or facility that is used for storing (e.g. a storage room, fridge, energy storage facility)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: individualAddress
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The individual address of the component
Camera of video surveillance
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SurveillanceCamera

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class is used to model devices that incorporates a heated rod and are used for rolling a person's hair into curls.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Cooker that is operated with electrical energy

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: IPAddress

This class is used to model game console devices. Console games are more commonly referred to as video games. They are played on a device specially made for game play called a video game console. e.g., playstation, xbox etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: InfraredSensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sensor that detects the presence of something moving in the sensor's range
Sensor that additionally to movement has a presence state
PresenceAndMovementSensor

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AiringFOA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Field Of Application for facility connected to airing with external air (e.g. air condition, airing system, air flow detection)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ContinuouslyVarDevice
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Appliances like light dimmers and variable-speed hand tools, with a continuous range of ON states.

This class is used to model a fan heater, also called a forced convection heater. It encompasses a variety of convection heaters that include an electric fan to speed up the airflow. This reduces the thermal resistance between the heating element and the surroundings, much faster than passive convection, thus allowing the heat to be transferred more quickly.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ThermostatNotificationFunctionality
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The thermostat request notification, requires a device having the thermostat control functionality to increase, set or decrease the current temperature. Derives from ZigBee HA (slightly modified...)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NightPowerTimeFrame
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Intervals for night power tariffs
A command that does not take any input parameters

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: UpDownRestState
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: State: up - down - rest

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Component to operate a device wirelessly.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WindowSensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sensor that controls if a window is closed

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PlayFunctionality
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Functionality to start a device's play function

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Emission
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Emissions caused by primary energy sources

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: timeToOff
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The time in seconds during which the object is turned on

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AnnualPowerTimeFrame
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power interval on the basis of a year

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Communication
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Appliances for communicate
